   21: %%
   22: -module(dtls_api_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: %% Callback functions
   25: -export([all/0,
   26:          groups/0,
   27:          init_per_suite/1,
   28:          end_per_suite/1,
   29:          init_per_group/2,
   30:          end_per_group/2,
   31:          init_per_testcase/2,
   32:          end_per_testcase/2]).
   33: 
   34: %% Testcases
   35: -export([
   36:          replay_window/0, replay_window/1,
   37:          dtls_listen_owner_dies/0,
   38:          dtls_listen_owner_dies/1,
   39:          dtls_listen_close/0,
   40:          dtls_listen_close/1,
   41:          dtls_listen_reopen/0,
   42:          dtls_listen_reopen/1,
   43:          dtls_listen_both_family/0,
   44:          dtls_listen_both_family/1,
   45:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_1/0,
   46:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_1/1,
   47:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_2/0,
   48:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_2/1,
   49:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_3/0,
   50:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_3/1,
   51:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_4/0,
   52:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_4/1,
   53:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_5/0,
   54:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_5/1,
   55:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_6/0,
   56:          dtls_listen_two_sockets_6/1,
   57:          client_restarts/0, client_restarts/1,
   58:          client_restarts_multiple_acceptors/1
   59:         ]).
   60: 
   61: -include("ssl_test_lib.hrl").
   62: -include_lib("ssl/src/ssl_internal.hrl").
   63: 
   64: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   65: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   66: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   67: all() ->
   68:     [
   69:      replay_window,
   70:      {group, 'dtlsv1.2'},
   71:      {group, 'dtlsv1'}
   72:     ].
   73: 
   74: groups() ->
   75:     [
   76:      {'dtlsv1.2', [],  api_tests()},
   77:      {'dtlsv1', [],  api_tests()}
   78:     ].
   79: 
   80: api_tests() ->
   81:     [
   82:      dtls_listen_owner_dies,
   83:      dtls_listen_close,
   84:      dtls_listen_reopen,
   85:      dtls_listen_both_family,
   86:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_1,
   87:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_2,
   88:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_3,
   89:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_4,
   90:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_5,
   91:      dtls_listen_two_sockets_6,
   92:      client_restarts,
   93:      client_restarts_multiple_acceptors
   94:     ].
   95: 
   96: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
   97:     catch crypto:stop(),
   98:     try crypto:start() of
   99: 	ok ->
  100: 	    ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
  101: 	    ssl_test_lib:make_rsa_cert(Config0)
  102:     catch _:_ ->
  103: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  104:     end.
  105: 
  106: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  107:     ssl:stop(),
  108:     application:unload(ssl),
  109:     application:stop(crypto).
  110: 
  111: 
  112: init_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  113:     ssl_test_lib:init_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  114: 
  115: end_per_group(GroupName, Config) ->
  116:     ssl_test_lib:end_per_group(GroupName, Config).
  117: 
  118: init_per_testcase(Testcase, Config)
  119:   when Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_1 orelse
  120:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_5 orelse
  121:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_6 ->
  122:     case ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,2}}]) of
  123:         {ok, S} ->
  124:             test_listen_on_all_interfaces(S, Config),
  125:             ssl:close(S),
  126:             ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  127:             ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  128:             maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(Testcase, Config);
  129:         {error, _} ->
  130:             {skip, "127.0.0.x address not available"}
  131:     end;
  132: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  133:     ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
  134:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  135:     Config.
  136: 
  137: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->     
  138:     Config.
  139: 
  140: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  141: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  142: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  143: 
  144: dtls_listen_owner_dies() ->
  145:     [{doc, "Test that you can start new DTLS 'listener' if old owner dies"}].
  146: 
  147: dtls_listen_owner_dies(Config) when is_list(Config) ->    
  148:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_opts, Config),
  149:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  150:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  151: 
  152:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  153:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> {ok, _} =
  154:                                             ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  155:                                         [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  156:                                         {error, _} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts])
  157:                                end),
  158:     receive
  159:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, Pid, _} ->
  160:             ok
  161:     end,
  162:     [] = listener_and_ports(),   %% Verify that ports are cleaned up after listener owner dies
  163:     {ok, LSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  164:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  165:     spawn(fun() ->
  166:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket),
  167:                   {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  168:                   receive
  169:                       {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  170:                           ssl:send(Socket, "from server"),
  171:                           ssl:close(Socket)
  172:                   end
  173:           end),
  174:     {ok, Client} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts),
  175: 
  176:     ssl:send(Client, "from client"),
  177:     receive
  178:         {ssl, Client, "from server"} ->
  179:             ssl:close(Client)
  180:     end.
  181: 
  182: dtls_listen_close() ->
  183:     [{doc, "Test that you close a DTLS 'listener' socket"}].
  184: 
  185: dtls_listen_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  186:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  187:     {_, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  188: 
  189:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  190:     {ok, ListenSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  191:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  192:     ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket),
  193:     [] = listener_and_ports(),
  194:     {ok, ListenSocket2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  195:     [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  196:     ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket2, 500),
  197:     [] = listener_and_ports(),
  198:     ok.
  199: 
  200: dtls_listen_reopen() ->
  201:     [{doc, "Test that you close a DTLS 'listner' socket and open a new one for the same port"}].
  202: 
  203: dtls_listen_reopen(Config) when is_list(Config) -> 
  204:     ClientOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  205:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_opts, Config),
  206:     {_, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  207: 
  208:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  209:     {ok, LSocket0} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  210:      spawn(fun() ->
  211:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket0),
  212:                    {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  213:                    receive
  214:                        {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  215:                            ssl:send(Socket, "from server 1"),
  216:                            ssl:close(Socket)
  217:                    end
  218:            end),
  219:     {ok, Client1} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, ClientOpts),
  220:     ok = ssl:close(LSocket0),
  221:     {ok, LSocket1} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ServerOpts]),
  222:     spawn(fun() ->
  223:                   {ok, ASocket} = ssl:transport_accept(LSocket1),
  224:                   {ok, Socket} = ssl:handshake(ASocket),
  225:                   receive
  226:                       {ssl, Socket, "from client"} ->
  227:                           ssl:send(Socket, "from server 2"),
  228:                           ssl:close(Socket)
  229:                    end
  230:           end),
  231:     {ok, Client2} = ssl:connect(Hostname, Port, [{protocol, dtls} | ClientOpts]),
  232:     ssl:send(Client2, "from client"),
  233:     ssl:send(Client1, "from client"),
  234:     receive
  235:         {ssl, Client1, "from server 1"} ->
  236:             ssl:close(Client1)
  237:     end,
  238:     receive
  239:         {ssl, Client2, "from server 2"} ->
  240:             ssl:close(Client2)
  241:     end.
  242: 
  243: dtls_listen_both_family() ->
  244:     [].
  245: %%    [{require, ipv6_hosts}].
  246: dtls_listen_both_family(Config) ->
  247:     {ok, Hostname0} = inet:gethostname(),
  248: 
  249:     TestIPV6 = case ct:get_config(ipv6_hosts) of
  250:                   Hosts when is_list(Hosts) ->
  251:                       lists:member(list_to_atom(Hostname0), Hosts);
  252:                   undefined ->
  253:                       ct:log("Local tests (ipv6 probably works)", []),
  254:                       true
  255:               end,
  256:     case TestIPV6 of
  257:         true ->
  258:             {_, ServerNode, _Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  259:             Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(ServerNode),
  260:             {ok, ListenSocket} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  261:             [_] = listener_and_ports(),
  262: 
  263:             {ok, ListenSocketIpV6} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, inet6, {ipv6_v6only,true}]),
  264:             [_,_] = listener_and_ports(),
  265: 
  266:             ok = ssl:close(ListenSocket),
  267:             ok = ssl:close(ListenSocketIpV6);
  268:         false ->
  269:             {skip, "Host does not support IPv6"}
  270:     end.
  271: 
  272: dtls_listen_two_sockets_1() ->
  273:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: 127.0.0.2:Port, 127.0.0.3:Port"}].
  274: dtls_listen_two_sockets_1(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  275:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,2}}]),
  276:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  277:     {ok, S2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  278:     ssl:close(S1),
  279:     ssl:close(S2),
  280:     ok.
  281: 
  282: dtls_listen_two_sockets_2() ->
  283:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  284: dtls_listen_two_sockets_2(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  285:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  286:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  287:     {error, already_listening} =
  288:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  289:     ssl:close(S1),
  290:     ok.
  291: 
  292: dtls_listen_two_sockets_3() ->
  293:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  294: dtls_listen_two_sockets_3(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  295:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  296:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  297:     {error, already_listening} =
  298:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  299:     ssl:close(S1),
  300:     {ok, S2} = ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  301:     ssl:close(S2),
  302:     ok.
  303: 
  304: dtls_listen_two_sockets_4() ->
  305:   [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: process1 - <all_interfaces>:Port, process2 - <all_interfaces>:Port"}].
  306: dtls_listen_two_sockets_4(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  307:     Test = self(),
  308:     Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  309:                   {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  310:                   {ok, {_, Port0}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  311:                   Test ! {self(), Port0}
  312:                 end),
  313:     Port =
  314:         receive
  315:             {Pid, Port1} ->
  316:                 Port1
  317:         end,
  318:     {ok, S2} =
  319:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  320:     ssl:close(S2),
  321:     ok.
  322: 
  323: dtls_listen_two_sockets_5() ->
  324:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: <all_interfaces>:Port, 127.0.0.3:Port"}].
  325: dtls_listen_two_sockets_5(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  326:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  327:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  328:     {error, already_listening} =
  329:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  330:     ssl:close(S1),
  331:     {ok, S2} =
  332:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  333:     {error, already_listening} =
  334:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}]),
  335:     ssl:close(S2),
  336:     ok.
  337: 
  338: dtls_listen_two_sockets_6() ->
  339:     [{doc, "Test with two DTLS dockets: 127.0.0.3:Port, 0.0.0.0:Port"}].
  340: dtls_listen_two_sockets_6(_Config) when is_list(_Config) ->
  341:     {ok, S1} = ssl:listen(0, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {127,0,0,3}}]),
  342:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S1),
  343:     {error, already_listening} =
  344:         ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {0,0,0,0}}]),
  345:     ssl:close(S1),
  346:     ok.
  347: 
  348: listener_and_ports() ->
  349:     timer:sleep(200), %% Allow some time to start och delete dead children
  350:     Pids = [Pid || {_, Pid, _, _} <- supervisor:which_children(dtls_listener_sup)],
  351:     PidPorts = [{element(2, erlang:port_info(P, connected)), P}
  352:                 || P <- erlang:ports(), {name, "udp_inet"} == erlang:port_info(P, name)],
  353:     PidWithoutPort = [Pid || Pid <- Pids, not lists:keymember(Pid, 1, PidPorts)],
  354:     PidPorts ++ PidWithoutPort.
  355: 
  356: replay_window() ->
  357:     [{doc, "Whitebox test of replay window"}].
  358: replay_window(_Config) ->
  359:     W0 = dtls_record:init_replay_window(),
  360:     Size = 58,
  361:     true = replay_window(0, 0, Size-1, [], W0),
  362:     ok.
  363: 
  364: replay_window(N, Top, Sz, Used, W0) when N < 99000 ->
  365:     Bottom = max(0, Top - Sz),
  366:     Seq = max(0, Bottom + rand:uniform(Top-Bottom+10)-5),
  367:     IsReplay = (Seq < Bottom) orelse lists:member(Seq, Used),
  368:     case dtls_record:is_replay(Seq,W0) of
  369:         true when IsReplay ->
  370:             replay_window(N+1, Top, Sz, Used, W0);
  371:         false when (not IsReplay) ->
  372:             #{replay_window:=W1} = dtls_record:update_replay_window(Seq, #{replay_window=>W0}),
  373:             NewTop = if Seq > Top -> Seq;
  374:                         true -> Top
  375:                      end,
  376:             NewBottom = max(0, (NewTop - Sz)),
  377:             NewUsed = lists:dropwhile(fun(S) -> S < NewBottom end,
  378:                                       lists:sort([Seq|Used])),
  379:             replay_window(N+1, NewTop, Sz, NewUsed, W1);
  380:         Replay ->
  381:             io:format("Try: ~p Top: ~w Sz: ~p Used:~p State: ~w~n", [N, Top, Sz, length(Used), W0]),
  382:             io:format("Seq: ~w Replay: ~p (~p)~n ~w~n ~w~n",
  383:                       [Seq, Replay, IsReplay, Used, bits_to_list(W0)]),
  384:             {fail, Replay, Seq, W0}
  385:     end;
  386: replay_window(N, Top, Sz, Used, W0) ->
  387:     io:format("Try: ~p Top: ~w Sz: ~p Used:~p State: ~w~n", [N, Top, Sz, length(Used), W0]),
  388:     io:format("Match ~w ~n", [bits_to_list(W0) =:= Used]),
  389:     bits_to_list(W0) =:= Used.
  390: 
  391: bits_to_list(#{mask := Bits, bottom:= Bottom}) ->
  392:     bits_to_list(Bits, Bottom, []).
  393: 
  394: bits_to_list(0, _, Is) ->
  395:     lists:reverse(Is);
  396: bits_to_list(Bits, I, Acc) ->
  397:     case Bits band 1 of
  398:         1 -> bits_to_list(Bits bsr 1, I+1, [I|Acc]);
  399:         0 -> bits_to_list(Bits bsr 1, I+1, Acc)
  400:     end.
  401: 
  402: client_restarts() ->
  403:     [{doc, "Test re-connection "}].
  404: 
  405: client_restarts(Config) ->
  406:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  407:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  408:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  409: 
  410:     ClientOpts = [{verify, verify_none},{reuse_sessions, save} | ClientOpts0],
  411:     Server =
  412: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  413: 				   {from, self()},
  414:                                    {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  415: 				   {options, [{verify, verify_none}|ServerOpts]}]),
  416:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  417:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode},
  418:                                          {port, Port}, {host, Hostname},
  419:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  420:                                          {from, self()},
  421:                                          {options, ClientOpts}]),
  422: 
  423:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  424:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  425: 
  426:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  427:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  428: 
  429:     Msgs = lists:sort([{Server, Msg1}, {Client0, Msg2}]),
  430:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  431: 
  432:     ReConnect =  %% Whitebox re-connect test
  433:         fun({sslsocket, {gen_udp,_,dtls_gen_connection}, [Pid]} = Socket, ssl) ->
  434:                 ?CT_LOG("Client Socket: ~p ~n", [Socket]),
  435:                 {ok, IntSocket} = gen_statem:call(Pid, {downgrade, self()}),
  436:                 {{Address,CPort},UDPSocket}=IntSocket,
  437:                 ?CT_LOG("Info: ~p~n", [inet:info(UDPSocket)]),
  438: 
  439:                 {ok, #config{transport_info = CbInfo, connection_cb = ConnectionCb,
  440:                              ssl = SslOpts0}} =
  441:                     ssl:handle_options(ClientOpts, client, Address),
  442:                 SslOpts = {SslOpts0, #socket_options{}, undefined},
  443: 
  444:                 ct:sleep(250),
  445:                 ?CT_LOG("Client second connect: ~p ~p~n", [Socket, CbInfo]),
  446:                 {ok, NewSocket} = ssl_gen_statem:connect(ConnectionCb, Address, CPort, IntSocket,
  447:                                                          SslOpts, self(), CbInfo, infinity),
  448:                 {replace, NewSocket}
  449:         end,
  450: 
  451:     Client0 ! {apply, self(), ReConnect},
  452:     receive
  453:         {apply_res, {replace, Res}} ->
  454:             ?CT_LOG("Apply res: ~p~n", [Res]),
  455:             ok;
  456:         ErrMsg ->
  457:             ?CT_LOG("Unhandled: ~p~n", [ErrMsg]),
  458:             ct:fail({wrong_msg, ErrMsg})
  459:     end,
  460: 
  461:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  462:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  463: 
  464:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  465:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  466: 
  467:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  468: 
  469:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  470:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
  471:     ok.
  472: 
  473: 
  474: flush() ->
  475:     receive Msg -> [Msg|flush()]
  476:     after 500 -> []
  477:     end.
  478: 
  479: client_restarts_multiple_acceptors(Config) ->
  480:     %% Can also be tested with openssl by connecting a client and hit
  481:     %% Ctrl-C to kill openssl process, so that the connection is not
  482:     %% closed.
  483:     %% Then do a new openssl connect with the same client port.
  484: 
  485:     ClientOpts0 = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(client_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  486:     ServerOpts = ssl_test_lib:ssl_options(server_rsa_verify_opts, Config),
  487:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  488: 
  489:     ClientOpts = [{verify, verify_none},{reuse_sessions, save} | ClientOpts0],
  490:     Server =
  491: 	ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  492: 				   {from, self()},
  493:                                    {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  494:                                    {accepters, 2},
  495: 				   {options, [{verify, verify_none}|ServerOpts]}]),
  496:     Port = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  497:     Client0 = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode},
  498:                                          {port, Port}, {host, Hostname},
  499:                                          {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, no_result, []}},
  500:                                          {from, self()},
  501:                                          {options, ClientOpts}]),
  502: 
  503:     Server2 = receive {accepter, 2, Server2Pid} -> Server2Pid
  504:               after 5000 -> ct:fail(msg_timeout)
  505:               end,
  506: 
  507:     ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg1 = "from client 0"),
  508:     ssl_test_lib:send(Server, Msg2 = "from server to client 0"),
  509: 
  510:     Server ! {active_receive, Msg1},
  511:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg2},
  512: 
  513:     Msgs = lists:sort([{Server, Msg1}, {Client0, Msg2}]),
  514:     Msgs = lists:sort(flush()),
  515: 
  516:     ReConnect =  %% Whitebox re-connect test
  517:         fun({sslsocket, {gen_udp,_,dtls_gen_connection}, [Pid]} = Socket, ssl) ->
  518:                 ?CT_LOG("Client Socket: ~p ~n", [Socket]),
  519:                 {ok, IntSocket} = gen_statem:call(Pid, {downgrade, self()}),
  520:                 {{Address,CPort},UDPSocket}=IntSocket,
  521:                 ?CT_LOG("Info: ~p~n", [inet:info(UDPSocket)]),
  522: 
  523:                 {ok, #config{transport_info = CbInfo, connection_cb = ConnectionCb,
  524:                              ssl = SslOpts0}} =
  525:                     ssl:handle_options(ClientOpts, client, Address),
  526:                 SslOpts = {SslOpts0, #socket_options{}, undefined},
  527: 
  528:                 ct:sleep(250),
  529:                 ?CT_LOG("Client second connect: ~p ~p~n", [Socket, CbInfo]),
  530:                 {ok, NewSocket} = ssl_gen_statem:connect(ConnectionCb, Address, CPort, IntSocket,
  531:                                                          SslOpts, self(), CbInfo, infinity),
  532:                 {replace, NewSocket}
  533:         end,
  534: 
  535:     Client0 ! {apply, self(), ReConnect},
  536:     receive
  537:         {apply_res, {replace, Res}} ->
  538:             ?CT_LOG("Apply res: ~p~n", [Res]),
  539:             ok;
  540:         ErrMsg ->
  541:             ?CT_LOG("Unhandled: ~p~n", [ErrMsg]),
  542:             ct:fail({wrong_msg, ErrMsg})
  543:     end,
  544: 
  545:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Client0, Msg3 = "from client 2"),
  546:     ok = ssl_test_lib:send(Server2, Msg4 = "from server 2 to client 2"),
  547:     {error, closed} = ssl_test_lib:send(Server,  "Should be closed"),
  548: 
  549:     Msgs2 = lists:sort([{Server2, Msg3}, {Client0, Msg4}]),
  550: 
  551:     Server2 ! {active_receive, Msg3},
  552:     Client0 ! {active_receive, Msg4},
  553: 
  554:     Msgs2 = lists:sort(flush()),
  555: 
  556:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  557:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server2),
  558:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client0),
  559:     ok.
  560: 
  561: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  562: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
  563: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  564: 
  565: %% Helper function for init_per_testcase.
  566: test_listen_on_all_interfaces(S0, Config) ->
  567:     {ok, {_, Port}} = ssl:sockname(S0),
  568:     case ssl:listen(Port, [{protocol, dtls}, {ip, {0,0,0,0}}]) of
  569:         {ok, S1} ->
  570:             ssl:close(S0),
  571:             ssl:close(S1),
  572:             {skip, "Testcase is not supported on this OS."};
  573:         {error, _} ->
  574:             Config
  575:     end.
  576: 
  577: maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(Testcase, Config)
  578:   when Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_5 orelse
  579:        Testcase =:= dtls_listen_two_sockets_6 ->
  580:     case os:type() of
  581:         {win32, _} ->
  582:             {skip, "Testcase not supported in Windows"};
  583:         _ ->
  584:             Config
  585:     end;
  586: maybe_skip_tc_on_windows(_, Config) ->
  587:     Config.
